content.body:
They are in the middle of migration from BB to GHE 
Migrated already 3k migration and aim to finish the migration before end of 2022

Facing the API limit limitation 
1) Support team recommendations were not to use a single user but rather implement a logic to separate across multiple users - they have processes that need to work with each repos - at the moment one call = one repository 
2) GitHub Ops was the 3rd recomendation, this is problematic as it is very time consuming to develop and they worry that as their setup grows in complexity - it will come back to the same issue 
@peter-murray recomments to use GH Apps and reframed the expectation that this should be a time consuming, complex work 
Customer agreed to implement GH Apps workaround per peter's recommendations and will report back once done. 

In parallel a security meeting with the Playtika team needs to be setup - client to share availibilities

nodes.text: Milan / Generali - live presentation on MSFT office on Generali connect day

content.body:
## ⚠️Status quo 
- Due to an abscence from the market for the past few years, GitHub has lost significant marketshare and today **GitLab is dominating the DevOps space locally**. They are by far the preferred solution by Enterprise accounts with small variations when it comes to Corporate and SMB

##  🧐 Main Challenges
- We have limited resources compared to GitLab (Italy represents for them the 4th country in Europe in terms of revenue) - they had 6 people in the latest event in Milano. 
- We are fighting against a pre-existing GL installation (started as free) on server 
- Customers voice feature disparity around Boards and Projects compared to GL
- Microsoft themselves are much weaker in Italy than in Spain for Example. AWS and Google are leading the CSP market localy 
- There is outright hostility coming from customers (e.g Eni), partners (e.g. Almaviva) and Microsoft themselves (STU lead Gabriella Lisi) 

## 💼 Political Landscape 
-  MSFT Italy GM Silvia Candiani is about to be replaced by current M&O lead Matteo Mille. Matteo was in APAC for the past few years leading partner engagements and has a good relationship with @pierluigi. He sees the value of GitHub and seems definitely more engaged than Silvia. The announcement is delayed by the present Italian elections who complicate Silvia's move. 
- [ ] @fabien965, @markostar to initiate executive relationship with Matteo

## 👩🏻‍🔧 TaskForce (Internal GitHub) Captured [here ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SOPnZUwqUOSOOvVWZRr6-eLEuq6Yajn2A682u4JhVqI/edit)

## Microsoft Italy Stakeholder Mapping 
- Captured by @juanjocarmena [here ](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/19G_6oX1HLLsJd9G_e27buTXQ60aJKucxa3bOCMZUVa0/edit#gid=0) - this will be the guildeline of which hubber should cover which MSFT IT stakeholder

## 📣 How are we increasing our voice on this market in H1 FY23

- [x] [Kiratech event ](https://github.com/github/EMEA-Marketing/issues/356) Sept 27 
- [ ] [DevOps track for Cloud Conference 2022](https://www.cloudchampions.tech/e/3015/Cloud-Day-2022) - confirmed speaker @chrisreddington Oct 27
- [ ] [Codemotion](https://www.codemotion.com/) - Oct 18 This is a large community event (1k participants expected) and we are looking desperately for english speakers to deliver a Keynote. 
- MSFT's Marco d'Angelo has agreed to offer this slot to GitHub but we urgently need to confirm participation @dassencio's team already said it won't work for them so looking at @chrisreddington @SvanBoxel @NickLiffen - please if you or anyone in your team can participate let me know

### Topics:
- GitHub & Microsoft Relationship
- DevOps
- GitHub Actions
- Esselunga Scenario:
- **Esselunga:**
- They asked them to build a full DevOps environment.
- They were using immature workflows, only just starting to use shared repo’s.
- The proposal was to offer a **unified** solution that could apply for all their development projects.
- They are mainly using .NET
- Proposal suggested ADO (Boards, Pipeline etc) as the main environment

### Before State:
- Not much internal development
- Julio runs their DevOps infra, his team does not build software. They just implement the DevOps chain (CICD, Automation, Quality Checks etc)
- There are multiple teams that consult with customers regarding projects and proposed solutions
- They suggest the appropriate tools and solutions depending on their clients tech stack

### Identified Pain:
- No reusable or mature DevOps workflow

### Tool Stack / Languages
- ADO
- GitLab as SCM and Repo
- GitHub sometimes used when building projects from scratch

### Requirements / Desired State:
- Automation and QA tooling

### Next Steps & Timeline:
- Schedule a call with their infrastructure team to emphasize the advantages of GitHub over GitLab and other tools
- If a customer requests a proposal they will reach out to us to work on including GitHub in the offer

@oanamariadinca

content.body: **25/03/22, Meeting Notes** ## **Attendees:** * [Claudio Sturiale](https://www.linkedin.com/in/claudio-sturiale-87487444/) - Product Owner DevOps - [Simon Remordina](https://www.linkedin.com/in/simon-remordina-4a1b364/) - Head of Developer Experience ## Meeting Purpose: - To discuss their DevOps tooling and systems. - To see if/how they use their current GHE licenses. ## Current tools: - GIT repo: Bitbucket on premise - CICD: Jenkins with shared library (self written) capable of centralizing the workflow logic of pipelines - Deploy: internally written tool integrated with Jenkins - Artifact repos - SonarQube - QualityGates in SonarQube for code quality - OpenPolicyAgent for rule enforcement - Docker - Kubernetes ## Background info: - They have a MSFT EA, with 778 GHE seats, but this team was unaware they had any GH licenses. - Simon used to work at Deutsche Bank, where they explored using GitHub but ran into some limitations regarding private instances. ## Pain points: - Deploying on a hybrid multi cloud environment with a private instance - Extending extensions (like GH marketplace ones) to meet internal company requirements ## Questions asked: - How do GitHub runners work? - What are the best practices for deploying to a hybird, multi cloud environment with a private instance? - For GH Marketplace extensions, Jira for example, is it possible to extend/modify their functionality? They have certain internal company requirements ## Main goals: - Consolidate tooling - Deploy to a hybrid, multi cloud environment with a private instance ## Opportunity: - 2000 developers, and growing. ## Next: - Schedule a meeting for a more technical conversation around GitHub @oanamariadinca @markostar @NikBernert

Here are the details of the event in Madrid, and the PDF invitation in attachment. Feel free to share and to invite prospects. I'll put up a guest list that I'll share with you at the end of August.

**The date of the event is Thursday 09/22, in the morning (11am-1pm), in Madrid, at the BeBanjo office** 

In a nutshell,  BeBanjo is a successful startup building software for the VOD industry. They are very agile and their workflow is 100% around GitHub. Their CEO agreed with me to host an event to share how they use GitHub. 

This is a good way to start conversations with our prospects in Spain and to involve our local partner (Everis). The idea is to invite 20-30 key people to a non corporate event, where they can be inspired by a strongly innovative company. 

In terms of format, we will provide coffee followed by the talks:
1) Quick welcoming / Everis & GitHub quick presentation (in English - by me - <5minutes)
2) How startups develop software / how BeBanjo uses GitHub (presentation in Spanish - by one of their engineers - < 20 minutes) 
3) Quick GitHub demo (by @helaili  < 15 minutes)
4) Q&As, networking.

cc @katfoz @asseh @Kingerr

**Overview of the company and context :**
Sapiens International Corporation is a publicly traded company that develops computer software for the insurance industry

They have made the decision to unify their stack early this CY and to start migrating to GitHub. However this migration has not yet materialised and they have been very quiet recently so we are not sure what is blocking them and we'd love to leverage this meeting to uncover some information. Are there any dependencies in place? Any operational issues? Perception issues? Migration concerns?

GHAS is of moderate interest, they feel like they are going to start looking into DevSecOps practices in the near future but they are not very far. They do not have any code scanning tool atm as far as we know.

Open AI conversations with MSFT and interest in Copilot (they have not yet activated it though)

**Outstanding issues / challenges in the account that may surface during the meeting** They are encountering some execution issues with GH Actions on some of their local runners, we instructed them to open a support ticket which they have and our support has requested addl information, we are addressing this actively.

🙏🏻 🦾 Ideal outcomes :

- [ ] Understand what is delaying the migration to GitHub and what we can do to accelerate it
- [ ] Present our vision for Copilot for business and Generative AI SW Development disruption
- [ ] Start giving them a taste for GHAS and secure a followup with CISO
content.title: SAPIENS Briefing for Thomas Dohmke visit to IL March 2023 #9959

**Iberdrola** (:es: ESR Top Account) has requested Avangrid to adopt GitHub Enterprise as their VCS.

Iberdrola has signed a contract with IBM last year that includes GHE on Bluemix (ref: https://github.com/github/sales-operations/issues/3979) 

Avangrid had 2 options: add more seats on Iberdrola instance (with IBM Bluemix) or run GHE on a separate installation.
During the summer (August) they had an internal discussion and they have decided to go ahead with an independent installation (20/30 seats opp).

I am going to manage the relationship from 🇪🇺 .

cc/ @asseh

content.title: Dedalus

content.body:
Customer CIO is willing to meet with us as they are interested in our capabilities of CE.
We need to be careful in how we frame this as we know the current state of CE.

That being said, Agents and Spaces can be an exciting angle to position our view on the future of copilot.
They will insist on one queston - how can we use gituhub to customise our code with our frameworks? 
We need to mention CM but also the fact that today it is working mostly with exotic languages not represented in the OS world. 

Here is a tentative agenda for the meeting 

- GitHub vision for Copilot (aqui hablaria de todo lo que hemos lanzado en CB ultimamente - Extensiones, Workspaces, Code Review, etc.) 
- The future is Agentic 
- How Copilot Enterprise is evolving currently
- Options for code customisation with Copilot 
- Where do we start ?

Participants : @juanjocarmena @rulasg @oanamariadinca 
MSFT : Cristian Dozo (AE)
